storyInfo: The refugees catch up to Dublinn, but find it to be a group of dead soldiers. Among them, Selmon identifies her own big brother.

attributes.content: Guys, I see people ahead! There's army!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: That way... er, seven? Seven o'clock?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Oh, no worries, we got the message.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: But are you sure that's what you saw? There's not a hint of human life anywhere in these parts... Why would the army be patrollin' out here?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Hand me the binoculars.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: There's very little terrain nearby that would conceal us. Everyone, please hide here for the moment.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I'll go with you. I'd know the Victorian Army more thorough than you, na?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Mm. Thank you.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Selmon, come take a look... If I crouch under this rock, the enemy won't see me from any angle, will they?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Hah, not half bad.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Good, then. God, we go through the wastes for four days without a peep, no Catastrophe or savage beasts... and then we hit a roadblock at the very end. Just our luck, you figure.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Now stop sticking your head out, keep low with the rest of us. It's been so long, you still don't trust Reed's lot?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: No, as a matter of fact. It's the bland type like her I least trust.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: She only wants to do stuff that doesn't offend nobody. That way, if she ever makes a mistake, it won't really BE her fault.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: You bloody... You just don't like her stopping us from going to Dublinn.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Maybe. But I don't say nothing to you neither, do I?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...Confirmed. It's a small-scale Victorian deployment, but judging by their equipment, not from a nearby barracks.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Their weapons are highest caliber. If we fought... there's very little chance we'd win.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: They might not be searching for us, but just in case, we'd better hide ourselves. Based on their current advance, they won't catch sight of us.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You don't give me lip for what I say because nobody listens to what I say.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Anyhow, I'm jealous of how she's taken over my show.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...Those troops are coming closer. Budge over, give me a good position to watch 'em.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: *sigh* I'm begging you, don't cause trouble now.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Wh—What's happening? Are they scuffling?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Some group ambushed them at a pass.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: S—So if we'd not stopped to hide just now, we would've been sprung too? Who was waiting there?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Hey... I can't make out too clearly, but those clothes they're wearing look a bit like Selmon's, don't they?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: That's gotta be... Dublinn, right?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...Dublinn.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: One dawn eight months ago, just after I'd finished work, I was eating breakfast in a cafe in County Peninsula.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: A voice came from my radio.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: It said, with their flames, they would cleanse Victoria of filth.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: In the name of the Tarans... they would declare war on Victoria.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: They called themselves 'Dublinn'.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...Just a bunch of greedy thugs trying to give themselves a title.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Thugs?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: The ones common sense would identify as thugs more or less all died in County Hillock.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Someone intended on using an entire city of Tarans to test the Taran-born Duke... but didn't anticipate the leader of Dublinn conversely exploiting that.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: After the conclusion of the incident, Dublinn successfully purged all unstable elements from the city, and further gained the surrounding Taran populace's support, escaping intact directly under Victoria's nose.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Dublinn's leader is undeniably well-versed in the behavior of nobility.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: It's no wonder, considering her background and her hidden supporters.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: That leader and her intelligence personnel are both fully aware it was the barracks that shelled the masses with dirty bombs, that being why the truth of the County Hillock incident will never be traced nor pursued.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: However... I've read the reports. All the reports.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Some say the Dublinn 'Leader' that appeared in County Hillock on that day... is more than one person.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: That doesn't match up with the other intel we got from the Dukes.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Have you seen these two jigsaw puzzles?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: They're exactly the same...
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: As long as the forms are identical, they can fill the same holes. And the moment you put them together like this, most people who cast an eye would treat one piece like the other's shadow.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...Shadow?
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: So that's why you suspect that previous arson case, the one tied to Dublinn...
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: It was only a suspicion at first.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: It was, until... the reaction from that Harmonie Feline fed me some interesting information.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Who knew the Duke of Wellington would actually turn a blind eye to King Gaeil's other descendant walking freely in the wilds?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Madam, as you predicted, someone took the people from those farming households in for questioning this morning.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: I looked into it. They weren't wearing barracks uniform. it seems they're not part of the nearby patrol at all.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Hm... say, if I asked for a holiday and went out traveling, what would the better location be? Leithanien, or Kazimierz?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Or maybe I'll run off even farther... just maybe, like my good friend from the school days, I'll take a trip to Yan?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: ...I don't understand what you mean.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: *sigh*.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Forget it. We'll be caught in a snare if we don't tiptoe... but either way, we do need to remedy this as best we can. Ensuring her safety is priority number one.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: My dear friend, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You're sure she's the one they're looking for?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Well, can you be sure she's not?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: We've got no other choice. Who let her be 'The Leader' too? We can't allow her to fall into anyone else's hands... especially not the Duke of Caster's.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Come, now. We need to pay 'The Brigadier' a visit.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Selmon, what do we do? You said you'd take us to shelter with a Dublinn squad, and now they're right here in front of us, fighting with Vic's army.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: My gut says we should head in and help the Tarans' troops. My brain says we need to show some loyalty before we join them... I mean, right, right?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: No, no, what are you people on about?! We'd never beat those servicemen!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: A—And besides... what would Reed's lot think?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: They're hiding over there. They're not that near us. Maybe they won't see what we're doing.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Oh, God, down goes another...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...We can't just sit here watching Tarans get beat to death, can we?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...Fionn, take a look behind. How are Reed's bunch reacting to this?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: All men, pull back! Prioritize shaking pursuit!
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Our investigatory mission is complete! We can't waste our time here. Dublinn's deployed far too many diversions.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Captain, human activity at three o'clock.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: ...Who are they?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Seemingly normal refugees, with improvised weapons.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Initiate contact, confirm the true situation. All men, prepare to fight on two fronts.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Beware the possibility of Dublinn's regular forces disguising as civilians.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Hey, what's he doin' pokin' his head out from the bunker?!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Oh, the unit noticed him. They're comin' over.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'll try and see about negotiatin' with them. I'll tell them it's all civilians here.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: No. Tara's local barracks—would never trust civilians...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...They've never protected us before.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hah... hah... hi—hi there... we're Tarans, we want to join Dublinn...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...Hello?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Guh—wh—what the hell?!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Fall back!
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: ...Retreat ASAP. These two units are attacking us simultaneously.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: But aren't Dublinn... meant to be defending Tarans?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...I can't give you a response. All I know is these soldiers are already dead.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Standard piledriver spear, Vouivre... you're ex-Tempest Platoon personnel, aren't you?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Oh! Have we met before?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Well, since we're not strangers, that makes things easier. We're not an ambush, and we've got nothin' to do with Dublinn either. You've gotten the wrong idea about us.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Hah, surprise, surprise. That Fischer boy only sent me out here to follow a trail, and here we've run into his true goal headfirst.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: No, I'd wager he sent me here specifically to wait until you ran into us.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Bagpipe, why are you protecting the Tarans?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Eh? Because that's our duty, right? The Tarans are Victorians too.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: If we've cleared up the misunderstandin', are we able to ceasefire? Attackin' civilians is a violation of military discipline.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...What gives you the continued right to say that?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Eh? What's wrong with me?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You seem to not be duly aware of the situation here.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Oh, excuse me, I'm very well aware.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: My friend said you wouldn't protect Taran civilians, and I've just confirmed she was right.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You're the same as that old Colonel Hamilton back in County Hillock, na?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: So even though I'm discharged? I'm positive now, I still have to fulfil a Victorian serviceman's duty, and do what you're not willin' to do—
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Defend these civilians' lives.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Then let me ask. Have you ever inquired into that white-haired Vouivre's identity?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: C—Come on, let's go, Selmon...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Everyone's looking to escape!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Ugh, now's not the time to be stubborn!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I know this is hard to take, but... what Ch'en said seems true... so, let's get away for now?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Come on, survive first, then we can talk after...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Who's that you're staring at? Wait, it can't be...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Bro.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: There, Fionn... Your wound is like last time's. It's not too severe.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But—it'll still hurt.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Nrgh, that's whatever... as long as I don't see blood. Anything else flies with me.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Coward. You said you'd help Selmon. All you've done was scarper with her on your shoulders.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: N—Nothing wrong with that, at least we made it out. All of us made it out.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Reed, I need to ask something... I've been wanting to ask it all day.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You and your friends seem to be professionals with this stuff. But—I still just don't get. Why do you say those people... those Dublinn people are dead?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Is there any off-chance they're sleepwalking? Maybe it's that witchcraft from the legends that makes people lose their consciousness?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Just... just on the off-chance, that they are sleepwalking, we could go and wake them up...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...We can't. I wish I could provide you some consolation, but—it's a unique Originium Arts I recognize.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: *sigh* Alright. I'm just a little frightened myself. What's Selmon gonna think, though?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: What's... wrong with her?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, go on and tell, Fionn, we all know her. You were the one vouching for her since the beginning. She's a good girl. We wouldn't have come with her otherwise.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: The... the truth is, I actually know her because she robbed me, once.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We sat down and got talking with one another in the end, of course. She just wanted a pair of sturdy boots. Her brother was out in the snow that winter with half his soles worn through, feet frostbitten something hideous.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: So you gave her yours?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: No, actually. Her brother went off to Dublinn. I was only in time to cover for them. Couldn't do them any solid boots quickly enough.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Fact is, she's been out here this whole time looking for her brother.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: What? She brought us to join Dublinn just for that?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: No, it's more than that, it's...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: She wanted to join Dublinn along with her brother, she just ran away on the way there. That was two years ago.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Think how tough it must've been on her, catching up to her brother today.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Say, how do you think my family's doing?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: They're still back living in the village. It's about time they replaced the roofing straw. Once we find a place to stop over, I'm getting a Messenger to ask how they're doing.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: It's alright, I'm sure they're fine. I'll help you find that Messenger, come then.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Grand.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...But where are we going? We chased a Dublinn squad that was all dead people, and Selmon's not found her own. Where should we head now?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: *sigh* Reed, what do you...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Reed? Where'd she go?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Thirteen, fourteen, fifteen... three less than in the day.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...I just don't get it. What kind of Originium Arts is this? Makes me sick looking at it.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: She squats behind a boulder, looking around.
The soldiers keep marching for their heart's destination, upon the twilight wilds.
The colors of the Dublinn uniform fade beneath layers of mud and soil. They seem as if held in a silhouette, one lit by a glimmer from somewhere unknown.
I just need to... pounce, then retreat, and I'll be fine.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: A hundred meters.
They turn to walk straight for the boulder Selmon hides behind.
Tch, he's at the back of the squad. Looks like he didn't get to be the leader. Made himself out so bloody big in all his letters.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: They're headed for... yeah, same direction as the letters said.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Fifty meters.
Selmon clenches the wooden cudgel in her fist.
...Is the city you're heading for that important to you?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Who's telling you to head on? You'd still go, even if you died?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Even though you're being battered by—wind, and rain, and all these people one after another? You'd still go?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Thirty meters.
She remembers the first time she saw Dublinn's troops, two years ago.
They told her, once she was decided, she could come to them. The Leader would give all Tarans a place to survive.
...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I... never could be as sure as you were. You never looked back, but I did.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: She rushes out.
Like those Victorian soldiers in the daytime did, like Ch'en did, these people that have ceased to be can be knocked down again, so long as every attack comes swiftly enough, ferociously enough.
Until they'll sleep peacefully in the soil of Tara, never called to stand again.
The soldier does not fall.
He merely stumbles for a moment from the blow to the neck, and then swiftly spins around, pulling out his sword.
He is ghastly silent.
You lot! Out of my way! I'll send you all right back with him!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: No, I will, I'll do it!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I was just here to find my brother, but you're all the same...
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: (Silently attacks)
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: —Piss right off! At least say something!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Grgh...
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Square, that was...
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Hah, bloody hell. Head, chest, it's just not enough, is it.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Her cudgel flies out of her hand blocking the next attack.
And in that moment, the soldier's mask falls off.
She feels a sort of illusion for a moment. As if the way he brandishes his weapon slows, for a fraction of an instant.
As if her brother is about to give him both his hands, like when Victoria's police accosted them in younger times, shielding her in his embrace.
And then she sees his familiar face all so clearly.
His forehead drips no blood, and his eyes turn no look to his little sister.
Those eyes gaze to the distant, vague horizon, a rage of firelight longing, burning within.
—Just like the night he decided he'd seek out Dublinn.
And Dublinn soldiers surround them. Selmon blankly, dazedly, reaches a hand out to the man before her.
Admiration, aspiration, guilt. Regret.
All swallowed up by the ice-cold fire that her fingertips brush.
Fear.
All she is left with is fear. The fear of that longing, maniacal, burning unto death.
And before time can move again, flames blaze high, incandescent sparks blossoming into the night sky.
So close her fingers could almost touch, a flame blooms forth, and vanishes again before she can grasp it. The soldier falls over, to the ground, and never makes another whisper.
